article.headline: UNLV 108, Long Beach State 73
article.story: LAS VEGAS (AP) -- Michael Umeh had a game-high 21 points and Ricky Morgan added 19 points and seven assists as UNLV never trailed and beat Long Beach State 108-73 Friday night in the season opener for both teams. The Rebels (1-0) went on an 18-4 run to start the second half -- including seven from Jason Petrimoulx -- to take a 71-41 lead. A Joe Darger basket with 2:21 to play put UNLV over the 100-point mark for the first time since a 101-78 win Dec. 17, 2002, against Tennessee-Martin. Louis Amundson added 14 for the Rebels, Petrimoulx had 12 and Dustin Villepigue had six points and a game-high 10 rebounds. Morgan and Umeh combined for 27 of UNLV's 53 first-half points and the Rebels shot 64 percent from the field as they raced out to a 16 point halftime lead. Long Beach State (0-1) got a team-high 14 points from Kevin Houston, but the 49ers committed 19 turnovers and shot 38 percent. They trailed by double digits for the game's final 31:29. Aaron Nixon added 13 points and Jibril Hodges had 11 for Long Beach State.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
